contract provides functions to check the price impact of a trade against an expected price (derived from an oracle), validate slippage, and implement a commit-reveal scheme to mitigate front-running. It is upgradeable and integrates with OracleIntegration and EmergencyController.","errors":{"AmountIsZero()":[{"details":"Thrown when a required amount is zero where it should not be."}],"InvalidAmount()":[{"details":"Thrown for generic invalid amount errors, typically when an amount is illogical in its context."}],"InvalidDuration()":[{"details":"Thrown when a duration parameter is outside the allowed range."}],"LM_SlippageInvalid(uint256)":[{"details":"Thrown when the slippage tolerance is set to an invalid value (e.g., >100%).","params":{"tolerance":"The invalid tolerance value provided."}}],"NotAContract(string)":[{"details":"Thrown when an address is expected to be a contract but is an External-Owned Account (EOA).","params":{"context":"A string describing the context of the error."}}],"NotAuthorized(bytes32)":[{"details":"Thrown when a function is called by an account that does not have the required role.","params":{"requiredRole":"The `bytes32` identifier of the role that is required."}}],"OI_MinAcceptablePriceZero()":[{"details":"Thrown when the minimum acceptable price is set to zero."}],"OI_MinPriceNotMet(uint256,uint256)":[{"details":"Thrown when a price is below the minimum acceptable price.","params":{"min":"The minimum acceptable price.","price":"The price that was checked."}}],"PG_FallbackPriceNotAllowed()":[{"details":"Thrown when `getExpectedPrice` is called but the oracle is using a fallback price, which is disallowed for this function."}],"SM_CommitHashZero()":[{"details":"Thrown when a commit hash for the commit-reveal scheme is zero."}],"SM_ControllerZero()":[{"details":"Thrown if the EmergencyController address is zero transaction cooldown is set to a value that is too high."}],"SM_OracleZero()":[{"details":"Thrown if the OracleIntegration address is zero during initialization."}],"SM_ParamsEmpty()":[{"details":"Thrown when parameters for the commit-reveal scheme are empty where they should not be."}],"SM_PriceNotPositive()":[{"details":"Thrown when a price parameter is not positive where it should be."}],"SM_SaltZero()":[{"details":"Thrown when the salt for the commit-reveal scheme is zero."}],"SystemInEmergencyMode()":[{"details":"Thrown when the global emergency system is active, preventing operations."}],"ZeroAddress(string)":[{"details":"Thrown when an address parameter is the zero address where it is not allowed.","params":{"context":"A update."}},"PriceImpactExceeded(address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"actualPrice":"The actual price of the trade.","expectedPrice":"The expected price from the pair."}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"calculateMinimumOutput(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"inputAmount":"The amount of the input token.","price":"The price of the output token in terms of the slippage."}},"checkEmergencyStatus(bytes4)":{"details":"This function is typically called by modifiers within the implementing contract to guard functions.","params":{"operation":"The 4-byte function from the trade, scaled.","expectedPrice":"The expected price from a reliable source (e.g., oracle), scaled.","token0":"Address of the input token.","token1":"Address of the output token."},"returns":{"isAcceptable":"True if the price impact is within the allowed threshold."}},"constructor":{"details":"Disables the regular constructor to make the contract For example, it might pause itself or enable emergency withdrawals.","params":{"emergencyLevel":"The system-wide emergency level being broadcast by the controller."},"returns":{"successFlag":"A boolean indicating if the shutdown was handled successfully."}},"getEmergencyController()":{"returns":{"controller":"The address of the EmergencyController."}},"getExpectedPrice(address,address)":{"details":"Reverts if the oracle is using a fallback price, as these are considered less reliable for this check.","params":{"token0":"The address of the base token.","token1":"The address of the quote token."},"returns":{"price":"The price of token1 in terms of token0 (price = price1 / price0), scaled by 1e18."}},"initialize(address,address,address)":{"details":"Sets up the initial owner and dependent contract addresses. Can only be called once.","params":{"emergencyControllerAddress_":"The address of the EmergencyController contract.","initialOwner_":"The initial owner of the contract.","oracleIntegrationAddress_":"The address of the OracleIntegration contract."}},"isEmergencyPaused()":{"returns":{"isPaused":"A boolean indicating if the contract is considered to be in a paused state."}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"preventFrontRunning(bytes32,uint8,bytes,bytes32)":{"params":{"commitHash":"The hash previously committed by the user.","operationType":"An enum or integer representing the type of operation.","parameters":"The encoded parameters of the operation.","salt":"A random value used to prevent hash collisions."},"returns":{"isValid":"A boolean indicating if the provided details match the commit hash."}},"registerCommitment(bytes32)":{"params":{"commitHash":"The hash of the user's intended transaction details."},"returns":{"success":"True if the commitment was registered successfully."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"setCommitRevealParameters(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"newMaxBlockDelay_":"The new maximum block delay.","newMinBlockDelay_":"The new minimum block delay."},"returns":{"success":"True if the parameters were updated successfully."}},"setEmergencyController(address)":{"details":"This function should be access-controlled within the implementing contract (e.g., `onlyOwner`).","params":{"controller":"The address of the new EmergencyController."},"returns":{"success":"A boolean indicating if the operation was successful."}},"setMinAcceptablePrice(uint256)":{"params":{"newMinPrice":"The new minimum price, scaled to 1e18 decimals."},"returns":{"success":"True if the parameter was updated successfully."}},"setOracleIntegration(address)":{"params":{"oracleAddress":"The address of the new OracleIntegration contract."},"returns":{"success":"True if the address was updated successfully."}},"setPriceGuardParameters(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"newMaxPriceDeviationEmergency_":"New max price deviation for emergency conditions (BPS).","newMaxPriceDeviationNormal_":"New max price deviation for normal conditions (BPS).","newMaxPriceImpactEmergency_":"New max price impact for emergency conditions (BPS).","newMaxPriceImpactNormal_":"New max price impact for normal conditions (BPS)."},"returns":{"success":"True if the parameters were updated successfully."}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"validateSlippage(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"actualAmount":"The actual amount received.","expectedAmount":"The amount expected without any slippage.","slippageBps":"The slippage tolerance in basis points."},"returns":{"isWithinTolerance":"True if the actual amount is greater than or equal to the minimum acceptable amount."}},"verifyCommitment(uint8,bytes,bytes32)":{"details":"The caller must be the original committer, and the call must occur within the allowed block delay.","params":{"operationType":"An enum or revealed details match the commitment and all conditions are met."}}},"stateVariables":{"commitmentBlocks":{"details":"Stores the block number at which a commitment was made."},"commitmentCreators":{"details":"Stores the address that created a commitment."},"commitments":{"details":"Stores active commitments for the commit-reveal scheme."}},"title":"PriceGuard","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"CommitRevealParametersUpdated(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when the block delay parameters for the status."},"checkPriceImpact(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Checks if the price impact of a trade is within acceptable limits."},"emergencyController()":{"notice":"The central controller for system-wide emergency states."},"emergencyShutdown(uint8)":{"notice":"A function to be called by the EmergencyController to trigger a state change in the between two tokens from the oracle."},"initialize(address,address,address)":{"notice":"Initializes the PriceGuard contract."},"isEmergencyPaused()":{"notice":"Checks if the contract is effectively paused, either locally or by the global EmergencyController."},"maxBlockDelay()":{"notice":"The maximum number of blocks that can pass between committing and emergency."},"maxPriceImpactNormal()":{"notice":"The maximum allowed price impact (BPS) for a swap during normal operation."},"minAcceptablePrice()":{"notice":"The minimum acceptable price value (in 1e18 precision) for any price check."},"minBlockDelay()":{"notice":"The minimum number of blocks that must pass between committing and revealing."},"oracleIntegration()":{"notice":"The contract that actual received amount is within the expected range after applying slippage."},"verifyCommitment(uint8,bytes,bytes32)":{"notice":"Verifies a revealed commitment against a previously registered one."}},"notice":"A security contract to protect against price manipulation and high slippage in params.inputAmount: The amount of the input token.
params.price: The price of the output token in terms of the input token, scaled by 1e18.
params.slippageBps: The slippage tolerance in basis points.

returns.minOutputAmount: The minimum expected output amount after accounting for slippage.

checkEmergencyStatus(bytes4).details: This function is typically called by modifiers within the implementing contract to guard functions.

params.operation: The 4-byte function selector of the operation being attempted.

returns.finalOperationAllowed: A boolean indicating if the operation is permitted.

checkPriceImpact(address,address,uint256.details: The acceptable limit depends on the current system emergency level.

params.actualPrice: The actual price realized from the trade, scaled.
params.expectedPrice: The expected price from a reliable source (e.g., oracle), scaled.

returns.isAcceptable: True if the price impact is within the allowed threshold.

constructor.details: Disables the regular constructor to make the contract upgradeable.

emergencyShutdown(uint8).details: The implementing contract defines how it should react to different emergency levels. For example, it might pause itself or enable emergency withdrawals.

params.emergencyLevel: The system-wide emergency level being broadcast by the controller.

returns.successFlag: A boolean indicating if the shutdown was handled successfully.

getExpectedPrice(address,address).details: Reverts if the oracle is using a fallback price, as these are considered less reliable for this check.

params.token0: The address of the base token.
params.token1: The address of the quote token.

returns.price: The price of token1 in terms of token0 (price = price1 / price0), scaled by 1e18.

initialize(address,address,address).details: Sets up the initial owner and dependent contract addresses. Can only be called once.

params.emergencyControllerAddress_: The address of the EmergencyController contract.
params.initialOwner_: The initial owner of the contract.
params.oracleIntegrationAddress_: The address of the OracleIntegration contract.

returns.isPaused: A boolean indicating if the contract is considered to be in a paused state.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.commitHash: The hash previously committed by the user.
params.operationType: An enum or integer representing the type of operation.
params.parameters: The encoded parameters of the operation.
params.salt: A random value used to prevent hash collisions.

returns.isValid: A boolean indicating if the provided details match the commit hash.

params.commitHash: The hash of the user's intended transaction details.

returns.success: True if the commitment was registered successfully.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns.success: True if the parameters were updated successfully.

setEmergencyController(address).details: This function should be access-controlled within the implementing contract (e.g., `onlyOwner`).

params.controller: The address of the new EmergencyController.

returns.success: A boolean indicating if the operation was successful.

params.newMinPrice: The new minimum price, scaled to 1e18 decimals.

returns.success: True if the parameter was updated successfully.

params.oracleAddress: The address of the new OracleIntegration contract.

returns.success: True if the address was updated successfully.

params.newMaxPriceDeviationEmergency_: New max price deviation for emergency conditions (BPS).
params.newMaxPriceDeviationNormal_: New max price deviation for normal conditions (BPS).
params.newMaxPriceImpactEmergency_: New max price impact for emergency conditions (BPS).
params.newMaxPriceImpactNormal_: New max price impact for normal conditions (BPS).

returns.success: True if the parameters were updated successfully.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.expectedAmount: The amount expected without any slippage.
params.slippageBps: The slippage tolerance in basis points.

returns.isWithinTolerance: True if the actual amount is greater than or equal to the minimum acceptable amount.

verifyCommitment(uint8,bytes,bytes32).details: The caller must be the original committer, and the call must occur within the allowed block delay.

params.operationType: An enum or integer representing the type of operation.
params.parameters: The encoded parameters of the operation.
params.salt: A random value used to prevent hash collisions.

returns.isValid: True if the revealed details match the commitment and all conditions are met.

calculateMinimumOutput(uint256,uint256,u.notice: Calculates the minimum output amount for a swap given an input amount, price, and slippage.

checkEmergencyStatus(bytes4).notice: Checks if a specific operation is allowed based on the current emergency status.

checkPriceImpact(address,address,uint256.notice: Checks if the price impact of a trade is within acceptable limits.

emergencyController().notice: The central controller for system-wide emergency states.

emergencyShutdown(uint8).notice: A function to be called by the EmergencyController to trigger a state change in the contract.

getEmergencyController().notice: Returns the address of the EmergencyController managing this contract.

getExpectedPrice(address,address).notice: Gets the expected price ratio between two tokens from the oracle.

isEmergencyPaused().notice: Checks if the contract is effectively paused, either locally or by the global EmergencyController.

maxBlockDelay().notice: The maximum number of blocks that can pass between committing and revealing.

maxPriceDeviationEmergency().notice: The maximum allowed price deviation (BPS) from the oracle during an emergency.

maxPriceDeviationNormal().notice: The maximum allowed price deviation (BPS) from the oracle during normal operation.

maxPriceImpactEmergency().notice: The maximum allowed price impact (BPS) for a swap during an emergency.

maxPriceImpactNormal().notice: The maximum allowed price impact (BPS) for a swap during normal operation.

minAcceptablePrice().notice: The minimum acceptable price value (in 1e18 precision) for any price check.

minBlockDelay().notice: The minimum number of blocks that must pass between committing and revealing.

oracleIntegration().notice: The contract that provides reliable price feeds.

preventFrontRunning(bytes32,uint8,bytes,.notice: A view function to validate a commit-reveal hash for front-running prevention.

registerCommitment(bytes32).notice: Registers a commitment hash for the commit-reveal scheme.

setCommitRevealParameters(uint256,uint25.notice: Sets the block delay parameters for the commit-reveal scheme.

setEmergencyController(address).notice: Sets or updates the address of the EmergencyController.

setMinAcceptablePrice(uint256).notice: Sets the minimum acceptable price for any check.

setPriceGuardParameters(uint256,uint256,.notice: Sets the main price protection parameters.

validateSlippage(uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: Validates if an actual received amount is within the expected range after applying slippage.

verifyCommitment(uint8,bytes,bytes32).notice: Verifies a revealed commitment against a previously registered one.
